sentences.tran: 我的手表从三楼掉到了楼下，却依然完整无缺。

sentences.tran: 我一路快跑冲过狂热的甲虫，经过一条长廊通向二楼，我在往西面的楼梯下去，来到一楼，我感到心情愉快，好像处在早期动作侦探时代一样。
sentences.tranLocal: I sprint through beetle mania into the longhallway that bisects the second floor, down the west staircase to the first floor, grateful to be in the pre-motion-detector era.

sentences.tran: 但是这四个孩子都挤在二楼一扇窗户的周围，这意味着他们有救。
sentences.tranLocal: But all four of them were huddled around a second floor window, which meant they could be saved.

sentences.tranLocal: This is our room, and yours is just across the hall.

sentences.tran: 许多人有财务问题，不过你的问题比大多数人的要严重。
sentences.tranLocal: A lot of people have money problems, but yours are more serious than most people’s.

sentences.tran: 一万英镑的奖金或一辆新车——随你选择。
sentences.tranLocal: A cash prize of £10,000 or a new car – the choice is yours.

sentences.tran: “牙科医生”一词意谓其工作是医治牙齿的医生。
sentences.tranLocal: The word “dentist”denotes a doctor whose work is the care of teeth.

trans.tran: 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷

trans.tranLocal: to dig large holes in the ground in order to remove coal, gold etc
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

sentences.tran: 他们学习了如何布雷。
sentences.tranLocal: They learnt how to lay mines (= put them in place ) .

phrases.tran: 酸性矿水排水；排泄酸性矿水

list.tran: 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）
使成矿（mineralize的过去式和过去分词）
使含无机化合物；使矿物化

trans.tranLocal: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere

sentences.tran: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。
sentences.tranLocal: I forgot to pack my razor.

sentences.tran: 你行李收拾完了吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Have you finished packing yet?

phrases.tran: 一包；（野兽等的）一群；一盒
塞进；挤进；塞满了东西；某地方挤满了人
冰袋；大片浮冰；[医]冰裹法
n. （海上相互重叠的）浮冰块，积冰
罩板包装（硬底上有凸起透明罩的物品包装）
不可靠的人，有敛癖的人

list.tran: （常用来构成复合词）充满…的，塞满了…的
可捆扎的；可打包的；可压紧的
包，包裹；套装软件，[计] 程序包
包装机；包装工人；罐头食品工人，赶牲口运货的人
包装；把…装袋（package的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranLocal: to stay somewhere or not do something until something else happens, someone arrives etc
a period of time in which you wait for something to happen, someone to arrive etc

sentences.tran: 快点！大家在等着呢。
sentences.tranLocal: Hurry up! Everyone’s waiting.

sentences.tran: 你在外面等好吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Would you mind waiting outside?

sentences.tran: 我们已经等了很长时间了。
sentences.tranLocal: We’ve been waiting ages.

phrases.tran: 请稍候，请稍等；请您稍候；正在暖机等待结束再开始使用

trans.tranLocal: a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand in order to protect it or keep it warm

sentences.tran: 一副手套
sentences.tranLocal: a pair of gloves

sentences.tran: 拳击手套
sentences.tranLocal: boxing gloves

phrases.tran: 外柔内刚；表面温和的东西
手套箱；手套式操作箱（真空设备用）
(向…)应战；接受(…的)挑战[亦作 gantlet]
n. （汽车仪表板上的）贮物箱
认真地;毫不留情地[亦作 without gloves]

list.tran: 给…戴手套；给…当手套用（glove的过去分词）

trans.tranLocal: a piece of cloth that you wear around your neck, head, or shoulders, especially to keep warm

sentences.tran: 他伸出手松开围在脖子上的围巾。
sentences.tranLocal: He reached up to loosen the scarf around his neck.

trans.tranLocal: an object that you use to protect yourself against rain or hot sun. It consists of a circular folding frame covered in cloth.

sentences.tran: 开始下雨了，所以特里西娅停下来撑起雨伞。
sentences.tranLocal: It started to rain, so Tricia stopped to put up her umbrella.

sentences.tran: 那天我就在海滩上度过，躺在海滩遮阳伞下面看书。
sentences.tranLocal: I spent the day on the beach, lying under a beach umbrella, reading.

phrases.tran: n. （美）遮阳伞（海滨或花园用的）

trans.tranLocal: dark glasses that you wear to protect your eyes when the sun is very bright

sentences.tran: 她轻快地戴上了一副太阳镜。
sentences.tranLocal: She slipped on a pair of sunglasses.

trans.tranLocal: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

sentences.tran: 漂亮的小姑娘
sentences.tranLocal: a pretty little girl

sentences.tran: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。
sentences.tranLocal: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.

phrases.tran: 漂亮男孩；脂粉气十足的男人；矫揉造作的男子
一大笔钱；大数目之金钱
[美国俚语]容易的；便当的；合算的

list.tran: 漂亮地，可爱地；恰如其分地

trans.tranLocal: costing a lot of money

sentences.tran: 城里最贵的餐馆
sentences.tranLocal: the most expensive restaurant in town

sentences.tran: 汽油越来越贵了。
sentences.tranLocal: Petrol is becoming more and more expensive.

sentences.tran: 摄影是一项很花钱的业余爱好。
sentences.tranLocal: Photography is an expensive hobby.

sentences.tran: 对于低收入家庭来说，儿童的安全设备贵得让人望而却步。
sentences.tranLocal: For low-income families, children’s safety equipment can be prohibitively expensive (= so expensive that most people cannot afford it ).

sentences.tran: 用错建筑工人有时会是代价高昂的错误。
sentences.tranLocal: Employing the wrong builder can be a horribly expensive mistake.

sentences.tran: 她丈夫喜欢的东西都很贵。
sentences.tranLocal: Her husband had expensive tastes (= liked expensive things ).

trans.tran: 便宜的；小气的；不值钱的
trans.tranLocal: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected
at a low price

sentences.tran: 便宜的火车票
sentences.tranLocal: cheap rail fares

sentences.tran: 市场上最便宜的电视机
sentences.tranLocal: the cheapest TV on the market

sentences.tran: 西班牙的房地产比这里便宜。
sentences.tranLocal: Property is cheaper in Spain than here.

sentences.tran: 廉价商店
sentences.tranLocal: a cheap shop (= one that sells goods cheaply )

sentences.tran: 这种设备相对比较便宜，而且操作简单。
sentences.tranLocal: The equipment is relatively cheap and simple to use.

sentences.tran: 这件外套超便宜。
sentences.tranLocal: This coat was dirt cheap (= very cheap – an informal expression 非正式用语 ) .

phrases.tran: [口]觉得身体不舒服；感到惭愧
低利借款；来得容易的非正当收入；在钱上好商量的人

trans.tranLocal: pleasant, attractive, or enjoyable

sentences.tran: 他们的房子真漂亮。
sentences.tranLocal: They’ve got a very nice house.

sentences.tran: 你们玩得开心吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Did you have a nice time?

sentences.tran: 天气真好，为什么不去游泳呢？
sentences.tranLocal: It’s such a nice day (= good weather ), why not go for a swim?

sentences.tran: 真是个惊喜！
sentences.tranLocal: What a nice surprise!

sentences.tran: 圣诞节的一个好处是全家可以聚首一堂。
sentences.tranLocal: One of the nice things about Christmas is having all the family together.

phrases.tran: 很高兴认识你；很高兴见到你

list.tran: 精密；美好；细节；拘泥细节

trans.tranLocal: If you try on a piece of clothing, you put it on to see if it fits you or if it looks nice

sentences.tran: 衣服和鞋要试穿以确保它们合适。
sentences.tranLocal: Try on clothing and shoes to make sure they fit.

trans.tranLocal: how big or small something is
to sort according to size

sentences.tran: 他是个小男孩，个子和约翰差不多。
sentences.tranLocal: He’s a small boy, about John’s size.

sentences.tran: 詹森的房子和我们的差不多大。
sentences.tranLocal: Jensens’ house is about the same size as ours.

sentences.tran: 这条狗体型很大，但还没有长足。
sentences.tranLocal: He’s quite a big dog, but he’s still not full size yet.

phrases.tran: 粒度分布；粒径分布；大小分布；径谱
孔径；孔隙大小；气孔尺寸
尺寸效应；规模效果；晶粒尺寸效应
人口规模；人口数量；群体大小

list.tran: 相比（size的过去分词）；按大小分类

trans.tranLocal: used to show that other people probably already know what you are saying is true, or expect to hear it

sentences.tran: 噢，当然是她赢啦。
sentences.tranLocal: Well, she won, of course.

sentences.tran: 你当然应该保留所有信函的复印件。
sentences.tranLocal: You should of course keep copies of all your correspondence.

sentences.tran: 今后当然会有遇到困难的时候。
sentences.tranLocal: Of course there will be some difficult times ahead.

trans.tranLocal: more than is acceptable or possible

sentences.tran: 你觉得音乐太响了吗？
sentences.tranLocal: Do you think the music’s too loud?

sentences.tran: 你往汤里放盐太多。
sentences.tranLocal: You’ve put too much salt in the soup.

sentences.tran: 路上车辆太多。
sentences.tranLocal: There are too many cars on the road.

trans.tranLocal: exactly

sentences.tran: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。
sentences.tranLocal: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.

sentences.tran: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。
sentences.tranLocal: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.

sentences.tran: 她看上去就像她妈妈。
sentences.tranLocal: She looks just like her mother.

sentences.tran: 你究竟想干什么？
sentences.tranLocal: Just what do you think you’re trying to do?

sentences.tran: 洗个舒服的热水澡，那正是缓解肌肉酸痛的好方法。
sentences.tranLocal: A nice hot bath – just the thing(= exactly the right thing ) to relax sore muscles.

phrases.tran: 就在那时，正当那时；正在那时
还是；完全一样；照旧（等于all the same）

list.tran: 有正当理由的；合乎情理的；事出有因的
可辩解的，有道理的；可证明为正当的
无可非议地；言之有理地
公正地；正当地；恰当地；正直地
调整（justify的过去分词）；证明…正当

sentences.tran: 算计算计买这么多东西要多少钱。
sentences.tranLocal: Work out how much all these things will cost.

sentences.tran: 问题不在于你读了多少书，而在于你读了哪些有价值的书。
sentences.tranLocal: It is not how much you read but what you read that counts.

trans.tranLocal: the number 80

sentences.tran: 这支乐队在80年代红透半边天。
sentences.tranLocal: The band was incredibly successful in the eighties.

trans.tranLocal: the standard unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia, and some other countries, divided into 100  cent s  : symbol $

sentences.tran: 它要三美元。
sentences.tranLocal: It cost three dollars.

sentences.tran: 一张十元钞票
sentences.tranLocal: a ten-dollar bill

sentences.tran: 在机场你可以使用美元或欧元。
sentences.tranLocal: You can pay in dollars or euros at the airport.

trans.tran: 销售；出售；拍卖；销售额；廉价出售
trans.tranLocal: when you sell something

sentences.tran: 哈维每做成一笔生意可得到50美元的佣金。
sentences.tranLocal: Harvey gets a $50 commission every time he makes a sale (= sells something as part of his job ) .

sentences.tran: 汽车推销员常常宁愿降价也不愿失去一笔生意。
sentences.tranLocal: Car salesmen will often bring down the price rather than lose a sale (= fail to sell something ) .

sentences.tran: 对伊朗的军火销售
sentences.tranLocal: arms sales to Iran

phrases.tran: 宅前旧货出售；在私家车库进行的家中旧货出售

list.tran: 畅销的；适于销售的；价格适当的

trans.tranLocal: having a particular quality to a greater degree

sentences.tran: 这起事故的教训使他变得更小心。
sentences.tranLocal: The accident taught him to be more careful.

sentences.tran: 这部影片应受到公众的更多注意。
sentences.tranLocal: The film deserves more attention from the public.

phrases.tran: 更多信息；详细信息；更多资料
需要更多信息；取得进一步资讯

trans.tranLocal: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people

sentences.tran: 请帮助我们。
sentences.tranLocal: Please help us.

sentences.tran: 他安排我们大家一起喝一杯。
sentences.tranLocal: He arranged for us all to have a drink.

sentences.tran: 我们俩她都请了。
sentences.tranLocal: She’s invited us both.

sentences.tran: 我妈要来和我们同住。
sentences.tranLocal: My mother is coming to stay with us.

sentences.tran: 现在就给我们捐款吧。
sentences.tranLocal: Send us a donation now.
